titlestmt.titleproper: John W. Haines genealogical research files 1782-1979 1931-1979
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: John W. Haines genealogical research files
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: John Wesley Haines was a navy captain and professional genealogist. He lived in Medford Lakes, New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of genealogical research related to projects for clients and on the Haines family. A set of surname files for a number of families contains copies of family charts, copies of printed materials, notes from published and primary sources (often cited), postcards, and incoming correspondence related to the research. There are also surname files specifically for Haines family members that include family charts, correspondence (much of it with family members regarding the research), and notes. The collection also includes manuscripts of publications by Haines on the Haines family, and notes, correspondence, and copies of original documents and published materials related to the research. There are a a few issues of the Haynes Eagle and a small number of documents from the 18th and 19th century, including deeds, receipts, and marriage certificates, and a few early 20th century school and birth certificates (mostly non-Haines, mainly Wagners).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
